definition: Longevity Hill in the Summer Palace 頤和園|颐和园[Yi2 he2 yuan2], Beijing
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
long life/old age/age/life/birthday/funerary
surname Shou
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
surname Shan

sentences.english: The path we are taking stretches between Longevity Hill and Back Lake.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在採取的路徑之間延伸萬壽山和背湖。

sentences.english: Longevity Hill is the focal point of the Summer Palace.
sentences.chinese: 萬壽山是頤和園的視覺中心。

sentences.english: And the Longevity Hill and Kunming Lake to the composition of scenic and tourist.
sentences.chinese: 以及以萬壽山和昆明湖等構成的景物遊覽區。

sentences.english: Atop Longevity Hill, overlooking Kunming Lake, is the Listening to the Orioles Pavilion Restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 在萬壽山頂上，俯瞰昆明湖，是聽鸝館。

sentences.english: Only the Lobgevity Hill remains inside the Summer Palace.
sentences.chinese: 只有這萬壽山在頤和園裏邊。

sentences.english: The tower is lined up directly with the statue of Kim Il-sung on Mansu Hill on the opposite side of the river.
sentences.chinese: 該塔與河對岸萬壽山的金日成銅像直接排列在一起。

sentences.english: The Summer Palace covers an area of 290 hectares, including the areas of Kuming Lake and Longevity Hill.
sentences.chinese: 頤和園佔地290公頃，包括昆明湖和萬壽山。

sentences.english: Now，we come to the top of the Longevity Hill.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們到了萬壽山的山頂。

sentences.english: The two main elements of the garden are Longevity Hill and Kunming Lake.
sentences.chinese: 頤和園最主要的兩大景點是萬壽山和昆明湖。

sentences.english: The Long Corridor is the longest walkway in the world and runs next to the lake beneath Longevity Hill.
sentences.chinese: 長廊是世界上最長的通道，延伸到萬壽山下的湖邊。

sentences.english: Now，we come to the top of the Longevity Hill。
sentences.chinese: 現在我們到了萬壽山的山頂。

sentences.english: Now, we come to top of the Lobgevity Hill.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們到了萬壽山的山頂。

definition: sky clears after rain/new hopes after a disastrous period (idiom)/every cloud has a silver lining (idiom)/see also 雨過天晴|雨过天晴[yu3 guo4 tian1 qing2]

to spread/to hand down/to disseminate

lit. three humble visits to a thatched cottage/cf famous episode in the fictional Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义 in which Liu Bei 劉備|刘备 recruits Zhuge Liang 諸葛亮|诸葛亮 (the Hidden Dragon 臥龍|卧龙) to his cause by visiting him three times
Liu Bowen (1311-1375), general under the first Ming emperor Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋, with a reputation as a military genius/also called Liu Ji 劉基|刘基
Hua county in Anyang 安陽|安阳[An1 yang2], Henan
Eastern tombs/Dongling district of Shenyang city 瀋陽市|沈阳市, Liaoning

using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness

Juyongguan, frontier fortress on Great Wall north of Beijing, in Changping district 昌平區|昌平区[Chang1 ping2 qu1]
